newsitem.title: SAO TOME AND PRINCIPE: Sao Tome calls for aid as disease hits cocoa crop.
newsitem.headline: Sao Tome calls for aid as disease hits cocoa crop.

text.p: The African twin island state of Sao Tome and Principe has appealed for financial and technical aid from abroad to tackle a disease which is threatening its entire cocoa crop.
Agriculture Minister Hermenigildo dos Santos told foreign diplomats at the weekend that 70 percent of the islands' exports were threatened by the crop disease, known as "thrips."

Over the past 10 years Sao Tome, which is one of the poorest countries in the world, has invested $50 million in loans from the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund in improving its cocoa plantations.
The government had hoped to double annual production of around 7,000 tonnes over the next five to 10 years.
